objective: Build an MVP multi-agent context compression engine with STM/CWM/LTM, compression triggers, retrieval-based rehydration, and token reduction metrics.

facts.text: Objective: build an MVP multi-agent context compression engine with STM/CWM/LTM, compression triggers, retrieval-based rehydration, and token reduction metrics.

constraints.text: Compression must be deterministic and inspectable (pure function, versioned rules, fixed ordering; reproducible retrieval; auditable).
Token usage reduction must be >= 50%, defined deterministically as (tokens_before - tokens_after) / tokens_before >= 0.50 using a fixed tokenizer version; log tokens_before/tokens_after/ratio.
UI must be minimal web-only; no CLI.

definitions.definition: Short-term memory store for recent context in the engine.
Compressed working memory: structured, persisted distilled state used to reduce context while preserving key semantics.
Long-term memory store for durable information, retrievable to rehydrate context when needed.
Conditions under which the engine compresses context/memory to reduce token usage.
Process of restoring needed context by retrieving relevant items from memory stores (e.g., LTM) after compression.
Measurements quantifying token savings achieved via compression (e.g., before/after token counts).

retrieval.notes: Keep core objective and determinism/inspectability constraint plus minimal memory-store definitions; needed to incorporate latest change request (web-only UI) without pulling extra items.
